definition: to conceal one's identity/to live incognito
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: He was living under an assumed name.
sentences.chinese: 他过着隐姓埋名的生活。

sentences.english: Q. Are you ready to change your life and not be able to walk in the street incognito ?
sentences.chinese: 你准备好改变你的生活并且隐姓埋名的在街上走么？

sentences.english: The names of workers at the site have been changed to protect their identities.
sentences.chinese: 为保护其研究员身份，工作人员已经隐姓埋名。

sentences.english: The reason for keeping personal names secret is that one's name can be used in sorcery.
sentences.chinese: 隐姓埋名的原因也许是名字被用于巫术。

sentences.english: I just wanted to be a ghost, completely anonymous.
sentences.chinese: 我只想像一个孤魂一样，完完全全地隐姓埋名。

definition: to roam far and wide/to drift with the wind
to go back to one's native place and live in seclusion
to bear humiliation to save one's skin (idiom)
to remove armor and return to the farm/to return to civilian life
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to be wronged/to be subjected to an injustice
